TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
3 minutes ago, akron said:

That texture work is so clean and nice. Mine's horrible by comparison. I want to make textures like that when I grow up

Beale is definitely a lot smarter about distorting things to work for him. Those blocks on the bottom are actually mapped as trapezoids on the heat shield...

EDIT: @Beale is that dark gray color lighter or darker than the Mercury/Hermes textures? If it's lighter I think I like it a bit better, plus it would be closer to the lighter color of the Karrot revamp.

Edited February 14, 2016 by CobaltWolf

5 minutes ago, akron said:

That texture work is so clean and nice. Mine's horrible by comparison. I want to make textures like that when I grow up

1 minute ago, CobaltWolf said:

Beale is definitely a lot smarter about distorting things to work for him. Those blocks on the bottom are actually mapped as trapezoids on the heat shield...

EDIT: @Beale is that dark gray color lighter or darker than the Mercury/Hermes textures? If it's lighter I think I like it a bit better, plus it would be closer to the lighter color of the Karrot revamp.

Thanks!

But, CobaltWolf is very right, it looks clean, but relies on some lack of detail to hide distortion.

The colour is Grey: 25. I think brighter than Mercury yes.

 

Edited February 14, 2016 by Beale
@Beale: alright, ITS EPIC!!! But I have one question. Tell me you're keeping the IVA from the old one.

That texture work is so clean and nice. Mine's horrible by comparison. I want to make textures like that when I grow up

4 minutes ago, Beale said:

Thanks!

But, CobaltWolf is very right, it looks clean, but relies on some lack of detail to hide distortion.

(In case your didn't see my edit above)

@Beale is that dark gray color lighter or darker than the Mercury/Hermes textures? If it's lighter I think I like it a bit better, plus it would be closer to the lighter color of the Karrot revamp.

EDIT: Every time someone edits a post in a rapid forum back-and-forth, a pupper gets sad.

Also, do you have a list of the remaining parts you were planning for it? Were you going to do separate RCS thrusters for the SM? Just curious so I know what/if gaps need to be filled by my non-canon Gemini parts. Once you have a model of the docking nose cone I'd love to have an FBX of it so I can check it against my ATV docking port and make any necessary changes.

Edited February 14, 2016 by CobaltWolf

13 minutes ago, CobaltWolf said:

Also, do you have a list of the remaining parts you were planning for it? Were you going to do separate RCS thrusters for the SM? Just curious so I know what/if gaps need to be filled by my non-canon Gemini parts. Once you have a model of the docking nose cone I'd love to have an FBX of it so I can check it against my ATV docking port and make any necessary changes.

List:

  • SM Roll Thrusters
  • SM Translation Thrusters
  • Service Module

Here is the rough model of the nose.

It is just a frustum, so you can have exact dimensions for ATV.

Height: 0.575m
Bottom: 0.625m
Top: 0.4625m

Proportions are good.

@Beale Did you separate the heat-shield and capsule? :0

Also how does the decoupler work? is it built into the SM?

 

Update:
I just realized that the Black Arrow first stage is almost as big as real black arrow, and the Black Arrow second stage is well over the size of the real second stage. Is there anyway they could be like... scaled down? Maybe a 1.25m first stage and a .625m second stage? And maybe even that .625m WaxWing you showed us a very long time ago.

Like really looking at it, Black Arrow is super OP compared to it's IRL counterpart!

@Beale: Glad to hear your making an IVA for Gemini (Kerbinai).

The decoupler is built into the SM, it is non-staged to prevent accidents.

49 minutes ago, Beale said:

A little more SM detail. It's very plain, but so was the real thing. It should look better with RCS components.

 

Integrated RCS? $$$$$$$
@BealeAny chance you will post a Dropbox link once Gemini is done for those of us who don't want to download another mod?

1 hour ago, Beale said:

I worry a separate heatshield would mess-up sizing and overall profile of the craft, how do you propose alternate?  

If the player removes the Ablator from the fore part in the Big-G configuration, it should be fine.

The Gemini is planned for inclusion into BDB.  

My thought would be to have it like the heatshield for the Hermes in BDB, where I believe both nodes are in the same space. I don't recall ever having issues attaching it. So then you'd have seamless attachment either way.

Also, come to think of it - since there is /already/ a 1.5m capsule in BDB, with it's own separate heatshield, which is going to have its autoshrouds separated into separate decouplers, why bother having it twice? We could delete one or the other to save room on the textures.

If it's alright with you, I'll be posting any dev work I do for my contribution here, to avoid similar confusion.

42 minutes ago, Svm420 said:

@BealeAny chance you will post a Dropbox link once Gemini is done for those of us who don't want to download another mod?

Of course! Just, keep in mind, the capsule is 1.5m - it will not connect well with any Tantares parts.
